title: A bail bondsman called me saying I have a unpaid balance its been two years since I was bailed out and I had given him 2500....
question: My question is ...is there a statue of limitations on the account I made payments to him and don't have the receipts he show a payment has never been made.
answers:
SOL is as follows:

2 years on verbal agreements

4 years on written agreements. Most likely in your case.

BW
No one but a California attorney can advise you on what statute of limitations applies in this case. It is doubtful though that the statute has run.

The statute of limitation has not run on this debt as my colleague has pointed out. Additionally, it begins at the time of default. If you made payments then the default date would be when you stopped paying.

Depending on your overall financial situation and the amount of this debt, you could investigate a bankruptcy to wipe it out.

STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR ENFORCEMENT:



Open Account (credit card): 4 years (2 yeas if not in writing)

Written Contract: 4 years

Domestic Judgment: 10 years (can be renewed at 10 years)

Foreign Judgment: 10 years
